dict.string: Display a map with an imagery basemap.
Customize map view's background by changing its grid properties.
Display the map at an initial viewpoint representing a bounding geometry.
Display a basemap centered at an initial location and scale.
Add, remove, and reorder operational layers in a map.
Access and create bookmarks on a map.
Get the draw status of your map view or scene view to know when all layers in the map or scene have finished drawing.
Determine if a layer is currently being viewed.
Set the map view to a new viewpoint.
Tap and hold on a map to show a magnifier.
Display your current position on the map, as well as switch between different types of auto pan modes.
Take a screenshot of the map.
Create and save a map as a portal item (i.e. web map).
Identify features in all layers in a map.
Display a map from a mobile map package.
Display maps and use locators to enable search and routing offline using a mobile map package.
Honor mobile map package expiration date
Access the expiration information of an expired mobile map package.
Take a web map offline with additional options for each layer.
Take a web map offline, but instead of downloading an online basemap, use one which is already on the device.
Add rasters and feature tables from a geopackage to a map.
Restrict zooming between specific scale ranges.
Set the map's reference scale and which feature layers should honor the reference scale.
Display your location history on the map.
Take a map offline using a preplanned map area.
Apply scheduled updates to preplanned map area
Apply scheduled updates to a downloaded preplanned map area.
Convert features into graphics to show them with mil2525d symbols.
Apply a colormap renderer to a raster.
Load a tiled layer from a map server with a URL.
Load an offline copy of a tiled map service as a basemap.
Download tiles to a local tile cache file stored on the device.
Display a layer from an ArcGIS map image layer service.
Apply a renderer to a sublayer.
Add, remove, or rearrange existing sublayers in a map image layer.
Load an ArcGIS vector tiled layer from a URL.
Load ArcGIS vector tiled layers using custom styles.
Load a raster from a service and apply a function to it.
Create and use a raster layer made from a local raster file.
Display a raster contained in a GeoPackage.
Create a raster layer from a raster image service.
Apply a hillshade renderer to a raster.
Blend a hillshade with a raster by specifying the elevation data.
Apply an RGB renderer to a raster layer to enhance feature visibility.
Use a stretch renderer to enhance the visual contrast of raster data for analysis.
Display custom labels on a feature layer.
Display a layer from a Web Map Tile Service (WMTS).
Display a WMS layer using a WMS service URL.
Change the style of a Web Map Service (WMS) layer.
Find features in a sublayer based on attributes and location.
Display a shapefile with custom symbology.
Display KML from a URL, portal item, or local KML file.
List the contents of a KML file.
Show a callout with formatted content for a KML feature.
Display a file with a KML network link, including displaying any network link control messages at launch.
Add OpenStreetMap as a basemap layer.
Display a layer from a WFS service, requesting only features for the current extent.
Load a WFS feature table using an XML query.
Browse a WFS service for layers and add them to the map.
Group a collection of layers together and toggle their visibility as a group.
Use annotation sublayers to gain finer control of annotation layer subtypes.
Render features statically or dynamically by setting the feature layer rendering mode.
Render features in a scene statically or dynamically by setting the feature layer rendering mode.
Show features from an online feature service.
Display features from a local geodatabase.
Display features from a local GeoPackage.
Open a shapefile stored on the device and display it as a feature layer with default symbology.
Display a feature layer from a service using the on interaction cache feature request mode.
Display a feature layer from a service using the no cache feature request mode.
Display a feature layer from a service using the manual cache feature request mode.
Select features in a feature layer.
Find features in a feature table which match an SQL query.
Limit the features displayed on a map with a definition expression.
Change the appearance of a feature layer with a renderer.
Generate a local geodatabase from an online feature service.
Create a feature collection layer from a feature collection table and add it to a map.
Create a feature collection layer to show a query result from a service feature table.
List features related to the selected feature.
Add or delete related features on an origin feature.
Query data using a time extent.
Add graphics with renderer to a map to change the style of all graphics in a graphics overlay by referencing a single symbol style.
Use a symbol style to display a graphic on a graphics overlay.
Display an alert message when a graphic is tapped.
Change the drawing order for a graphic.
Use the Sketch Editor to edit or sketch a new point, line, or polygon geometry on a map.
Show a callout with the latitude and longitude of user-tapped points.
Show a legend for all the operational layers in the map.
Show a simple marker symbol on a map.
Display common symbols for all graphics in a graphics overlay with a renderer.
Render features in a layer using a distinct symbol for each unique attribute value.
Display coordinate system grids including Latitude/Longitude, MGRS, UTM and USNG on a map view.
Create graphics using a local mil2525d style file and an XML file with key/value pairs for each graphic, and display the military symbols in 3D.
Read symbols from a mobile style
Combine multiple symbols from a mobile style file into a single symbol.
Find the location for an address.
Use an online service to find the address for a tapped point.
Find places of interest near a location or within a specific area.
Geocode addresses to locations and reverse geocode locations to addresses offline.
Synchronize offline edits with a feature service.
Add features to a feature layer.
Delete features from an online feature service.
Update feature attributes in an online feature service.
Update a feature's location in an online feature service.
Add, delete, and download attachments for features from a service.
View, edit, or add features using a popup.
Synchronize offline edits with a feature service using a popup.
Project a point from one spatial reference to another.
Find the union, intersection, or difference of two geometries.
Format coordinates in a variety of common notations.
Get a list of suitable transformations for projecting a geometry between two spatial references with different horizontal datums.
Calculate a geodesic path between two points and measure its distance.
Cut a geometry along a polyline.
Clip a geometry with another geometry.
Determine spatial relationships between two geometries.
Apply densify and generalize functions to multipart geometry.
Create a buffer around a map point and display the results as a graphic.
Display directions for a route between two points.
Find a route that reaches all stops without crossing any barriers.
Solve a route on-the-fly using offline data.
Find the service area within a network from a given point.
Find closest facility to multiple incidents (service)
Find routes from several locations to the respective closest facility.
Use a geoprocessing service and a set of features to identify statistically significant hot spots and cold spots.
Query a table to get aggregated statistics back for a specific field.
Query a feature table for statistics, grouping and sorting by different fields.
Calculate a viewshed using a geoprocessing service, in this case showing what parts of a landscape are visible from points on mountainous terrain.
Analyze the viewshed for a camera. A viewshed shows the visible and obstructed areas from an observer's vantage point.
Perform a viewshed analysis from a defined vantage point.
Analyze the viewshed for an object (geo element) in a scene.
Perform a line of sight analysis between two points in real time.
Show a line of sight between two moving objects.
Measure distances between two points in 3D.
Shows a list of users in a portal group.
Shows how to search for webmaps within a portal using a keyword.
Connect to an IWA secured portal and search for maps.
Authenticate with ArcGIS Online (or your own portal) using OAuth2 to access secured resources, such as private web maps or layers.
Access a web map that is secured with ArcGIS token-based authentication.
Get the elevation for a given point on a surface in a scene.
Set the terrain surface with elevation described by a raster file.
Create terrain surface from a local raster
Set the terrain surface with elevation described by a local tile package.
Create terrain surface from a local tile package
This sample shows you how to open a web scene from a portal item.
The sample shows you how to display a scene with elevation data
The sample shows you how to render graphics extruded in z direction
The sample shows how to create symbols with different 3D shapes
The sample shows how to position graphics using different surface placements
The sample shows how to use a scene layer in a scene
This sample demonstrates how to update the orientation of graphics in graphics overlay using expressions on scene properties
This sample demonstrates how to animate a graphicâ€™s position and rotation and have the camera follow it

Demonstrates how to create a graphic using a distance composite scene symbol. Distance composite scene symbols can render different symbols depending on the distance between the camera and the graphic.
This sample demonstrates how to use terrain exaggeration on a surface in a scene
This sample demonstrates how to apply extrusion to a renderer on a feature layer
This sample demonstrates how to identify geoelements in a scene layer.
Demonstrates how to keep the viewpoints of two map or scene views in sync with each other.
Change the appearance of the atmosphere in a scene.
View an integrated mesh layer from a scene service.
View content beneath the terrain surface
See through terrain in a scene and move the camera underground.
View a point scene layer from a scene service
Opens and displays a scene from a Mobile Scene Package (.mspk).
Control the behavior of the camera in a scene.
Perform a connected trace against an electric Utility Network.
Tap on real-world objects to collect data.
Use augmented reality (AR) to pin a scene to a table or desk for easy exploration.
Use augmented reality (AR) to quickly explore a scene more naturally than you could with a touch or mouse interface.
